stories.text:
I haven't been able to post this link <https://physics.stackexchange.com/questions/197397/misconceptions-about-the-universe-hubble-sphere> in a youtube comment, youtube deletes it in ~30 seconds

Though I did manage to post an answer-link here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q67vH0SKahU&lc=UgyQizABsao1A9EWtlF4AaABAg . But I haven't been able to replicate this

Anybody knows what's going on?, why that one got posted and the others didn't?

I rarely make comments, less than once a month, and I never use insults, I think I'm very polite and conservative when I critic something, so I don't think is related to my account
stories.title: YouTube Autodeletes Comments with Links
The scientist at the center of the Covid lab leak controversy
About Code Verify – WhatsApp Help Center

stories.text:
I'm working on a codebase and I run into these sometimes. It really is a pain whenever I read them, as my understanding of the code actually goes DOWN while I read out of sync comments.

Wondering if you guys ever ran into this problem, and how you get around it. Interested in what you guys think.
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you deal with out of sync comments?

stories.text:
So there's the website https://caniuse.com/ which is very useful for determining what browser features are supported by what percentage of the internet.

Is there a similar thing for Android/iOS?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there a caniuse for mobile phone hardware?
